instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: MacBook Air "Core i5" 1.4 11" (Early 2014) - Backlight but no image
threads.message: MacBook Air "Core i5" 1.4 11" (Early 2014) - Backlight but no image, tried thunderbolt out still no image.  No dong on startup.  Tried resetting SMC, but no change.

threads.title: MacBook Air "Core i5" 1.4 11" (Early 2014) - Backlight but no image
threads.message: PRAM reset will bring back the chime. These power up to a dark screen with backlight. Remove SSD and wait for the question mark.

threads.title: MacBook Air "Core i5" 1.4 11" (Early 2014) - Backlight but no image
threads.message: Thanks as always.  Okay got the question mark folder.  Does this mean that it's a bad SSD or possibly a problem with the SSD slot?

threads.title: MacBook Air "Core i5" 1.4 11" (Early 2014) - Backlight but no image
MacBook Air "Core i5" 1.4 11" (Early 2014) - Backlight but no image
threads.message: is than anyway to test SSD without a similar or exact model MBA?

threads.title: MacBook Air "Core i5" 1.4 11" (Early 2014) - Backlight but no image
threads.message: yes, use a usb caddy. look at the tools forum.

threads.title: MacBook Air "Core i5" 1.4 11" (Early 2014) - Backlight but no image
threads.message: If the SSD hangs the system it is dead.

threads.title: MacBook Air "Core i5" 1.4 11" (Early 2014) - Backlight but no image
threads.message: Okay got a new SSD and now the computer boots into recovery utility, and recognizes the new SSD but cannot format the new SSD.

threads.title: MacBook Air "Core i5" 1.4 11" (Early 2014) - Backlight but no image
threads.message: First remove the existing partition, then create a new one.

threads.title: MacBook Air "Core i5" 1.4 11" (Early 2014) - Backlight but no image
threads.message: Well it's going in and out of even recognizing the new PCI-E SSD.  Is there likely a logic board issue?

threads.title: MacBook Air "Core i5" 1.4 11" (Early 2014) - Backlight but no image
threads.message: No idea, inspect connector and caps in PCIe lines. Test drive in known good machine.
